person.persName: John Smith Hurt (Owingsville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joshua Hurt and Elizabeth Pebworth Hurt. Educated at the academy of Hugh B. Todd and William Raney in Mount Sterling, Kentucky. Resident of Owingsville from 1844 to 1846. Served in the Second Regiment Kentucky Volutneers in the Mexican-American War from 1846 to 1847. Studied law with Andrew Trumbo of Owingsville in 1847. Admitted to the bar. Moved to California from 1849 to 1851. Returned to Owingsville. County Attorney for Bath County, Kentucky, from 1851 to 1858. Attorney in Owingville from 1858 to 1861. Colonel of the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Regiment, U.S.A. August 1863 to January 1865. Attorney in Owingsville in 1865. Unsuccessful candidate for the Kentucky General Assembly in August 1865. Member of the Democratic Party.
